alert.note: Alert for Belknap; Cheshire; Merrimack; Southern Carroll; Western And Central Hillsborough (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 15 at 3:28AM EST until January 15 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 25 below zero. For the Winter Storm Watch, heavy snow possible Monday. Total snow accumulations of 6 more inches possible. * WHERE...Portions of central, northern and southern New Hampshire and western Maine. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Advisory, until 1 PM EST this afternoon. For the Winter Storm Watch, from late Sunday night through Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult Monday. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. The cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes.
info.instruction: Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

area.areaDesc: Belknap; Cheshire; Merrimack; Southern Carroll; Western And Central Hillsborough
